summary: Emily Greene Balch  shared the Nobel Peace Prize in 1946 with John Raleigh Mott .
full_text: Emily Greene Balch  was an American economist, sociologist and pacifist. Balch combined an academic career at Wellesley College with a long-standing interest in social issues such as poverty, child labor and immigration, as well as settlement work to uplift poor immigrants and reduce juvenile delinquency. She moved into the peace movement at the start of the World War I in 1914, and began collaborating with Jane Addams of Chicago. She became a central leader of the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom  based in Switzerland, for which she won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1946.
title: Emily Greene Balch
